content.description: Sit start at the west arete with hands on two opposing sidepulls, or whatever feels comfortable, as the sit is a bit awkward.  From there, move up the overhang using the large shelf, stand tall to a good jug at the lip, move right, and top it out.  The rock quality is pretty good where the problem climbs.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot, the landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the West arete of Anniversary Rock's South face.

content.description:
Stephie Pockets shares much of the same problem as

Thank You, Dr. Pearson

, but instead of following the arete to the lip, it climbs the diagonal sloper-shelf on the face.

Sit start with a pair of sidepulls and bunched feet. From there, reach a left hand edge, follow to a right hand jug, match on it, cross over with the left hand to a three-finger incut edge, match a heel hook next to the right hand, then move to a sloping right hand edge, set, dyno to the lip, traverse slightly right, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location:
It climbs the south face of Anniversary Rock. This shares the same start and finish as

Thank You, Dr.  Pearson

.
